TopicTitle: Is this computer good for gaming?

Articles.Content:
I am saving up for a new computer, and is this good for gaming:

http://www.microsoftstore.com/store/msusa/en_US/pdp/Dell-Inspiron-15-i5558-5716SLV-Signature-Edition-Laptop/productID.323246000

No, it isn't. Also, requesting that this thread be moved into the computer building/buying thread.

Integrated graphics aren't in the high end of graphics. Look for something with a dedicated GPU.

http://store.hp.com/UKStore/Merch/Product.aspx?id=M0R71EA&opt=ABU&sel=NTB

Seems to be in a similar range all round to what I'm saving for. Including price when using the same currency.

Options are limited when you can only pay in person...
Again, I would recommend a desktop if you can. If not, here are suggestions in the price range
A desktop isn't an option for me.
Then that is a pretty good option.
Sorry for diverting attention from the original post:p
Also, buy from the microsoft store and get signature edition laptops if you can. They come with clean operating system installs, so no bloatware.
In that pricerange you will get an Intel dualcore and something like a Geforce 940M. Those will have problems with new games, even on low settings...

Also, buy from the microsoft store and get signature edition laptops if you can. They come with clean operating system installs, so no bloatware.

What about this one?

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/asus-desktop-amd-a10-series-12gb-memory-2tb-hard-drive-gray-black/9570089.p?id=1219704994489&skuId=9570089
Is a desktop an option for you there? A one that you build instead? Because that has an APU instead of a dedicated graphics card.
Please please build it yourself if you can. Go to reddit r/buildapc
Or go to the thread we have on the forums, here:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25004-KSP-Unofficial-Official-Computer-Building-Buying-Megathread-%28All-Questions-Acceptable-%29/page236
